Chapter.Label: Chapter_Sheaf_cohomology_by_use_of_cohomology_theorem_in_httpsarxivorgabs180208860
Chapter.Heading: Sheaf cohomology by use of cohomology theorem in https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.08860

ManSection.Description: Given a toric variety V, we eventually wish to compute the i-th sheaf cohomology of the sheafification of the f.p. graded S-module M_2 (S being the Cox ring of vari). To this end we use modules M_1 which sheafify to the structure sheaf of vari. This method tests if the truncation to degree zero of Ext^i_S( M_1, M_2 ) is isomorphic to H^i( V, \widetilde{M_2} ).

Given a toric variety V and an f.p. graded S-module M (S being the Cox ring of vari), we wish to compute the i-th sheaf cohomology of \tilde{M}. To this end, this method identifies an ideal I of S such that \tilde{I} is the structure sheaf of V and such that Ext^i_S( I, M ) is isomorphic to H^i( V, \tilde{M} ). We identify I by determining an ample degree d \in \mathrm{Cl} ( V ). Then, for a suitable non-negative integer e, the generators of I are the e-th power of all monomials of degree d in the Cox ring of S. We return the list [ e, d, I ].

Oper.Name: H0
Oper.Label: for IsToricVariety, IsFpGradedLeftOrRightModulesObject, IsBool, IsBool, IsBool

ManSection.Returns: a list consisting of an integer and a vector space
ManSection.Description: Computation of sheaf cohomology from my theorem

ManSection.Returns: a list consisting of an integer and a vector space
ManSection.Description: Computation of sheaf cohomology from my own theorem, but in parallel (by forking).

ManSection.Description: Computation of all sheaf cohomology classes from my theorem

ManSection.Description: Computation of all sheaf cohomology classes from my theorem, but by use of parallelisation.

Subsection.Label: Chapter_Sheaf_cohomology_by_use_of_cohomology_theorem_in_httpsarxivorgabs180208860_Section_Examples_Subsection_Sheaf_cohomology_of_toric_vector_bundles
Subsection.Heading: Sheaf cohomology of toric vector bundles
Subsection.Example:
gap> F1 := Fan( [[1],[-1]],[[1],[2]] ); <A fan in |R^1> gap> P1 := ToricVariety( F1 ); <A toric variety of dimension 1> gap> P1xP1 := P1 * P1; <A toric variety of dimension 2 which is a product of 2 toric varieties> gap> VForCAP := AsFreydCategoryObject( GradedRow( [[[1,1],1],[[-2,0],1]], CoxRing( P1xP1 ) ) ); <A projective object in Category of f.p. graded left modules over Q[x_1,x_2,x_3,x_4] (with weights [ [ 0, 1 ], [ 1, 0 ], [ 1, 0 ], [ 0, 1 ] ])> gap> V2ForCAP := AsFreydCategoryObject( GradedRow( [[[-2,0],1]], CoxRing( P1xP1 ) ) ); <A projective object in Category of f.p. graded left modules over Q[x_1,x_2,x_3,x_4] (with weights [ [ 0, 1 ], [ 1, 0 ], [ 1, 0 ], [ 0, 1 ] ])> gap> AllHi( P1xP1, VForCAP, false, false ); Computing h^0 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^1 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^2 ----------------------------------------------
[ [ 0, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 4> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 1> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ] ] gap> AllHiParallel( P1xP1, VForCAP, false, false ); Computing h^0 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^1 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^2 ----------------------------------------------
[ [ 0, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 4> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 1> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ] ] gap> AllHi( P1xP1, V2ForCAP, false, false ); Computing h^0 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^1 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^2 ----------------------------------------------
[ [ 0, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 1> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ] ] gap> AllHiParallel( P1xP1, V2ForCAP, false, false ); Computing h^0 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^1 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^2 ----------------------------------------------
[ [ 0, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 1> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ] ]

Subsection.Label: Chapter_Sheaf_cohomology_by_use_of_cohomology_theorem_in_httpsarxivorgabs180208860_Section_Examples_Subsection_Sheaf_cohomologies_of_the_irrelevant_ideal_of_P1xP1
Subsection.Heading: Sheaf cohomologies of the irrelevant ideal of P1xP1
Subsection.Example:
gap> irP1xP1 := IrrelevantLeftIdealForCAP( P1xP1 ); <An object in Category of f.p. graded left modules over Q[x_1,x_2,x_3,x_4] (with weights [ [ 0, 1 ], [ 1, 0 ], [ 1, 0 ], [ 0, 1 ] ])> gap> AllHi( P1xP1, irP1xP1, false, false ); Computing h^0 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^1 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^2 ----------------------------------------------
[ [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 1> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ], [ 0, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ] ] gap> AllHiParallel( P1xP1, irP1xP1, false, false ); Computing h^0 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^1 ----------------------------------------------
Computing h^2 ----------------------------------------------
[ [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 1> ], [ 1, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ], [ 0, <A vector space object over Q of dimension 0> ] ]
